alert.note: Alert for Adams; Brown (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 2:42PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EASTERN BROWN AND ADAMS COUNTIES THROUGH 315 PM EDT... At 242 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near West Union, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, half inch hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... West Union, Manchester, Winchester, Seaman, Rome, Blue Creek, Cherry Fork, Concord, Bentonville, Dunkinsville, State Route 348 at State Route 125 and Cedar Mills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for northeastern Kentucky...and southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
